definition: stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns
variant of 稱|称[cheng1], to weigh

sentences.english: Today this is known as a ★ steelyard scale 13 .
sentences.chinese: 如今這種天平被稱作“桿秤”。

sentences.english: Weigh this ring in the small steelyard .
sentences.chinese: 把這個戒指在桿秤上稱一稱。

sentences.english: This kind of lever scale is very exact and is used by many consumers.
sentences.chinese: 這桿秤非常精準，買菜的人都用它。

sentences.english: The lever device in this paper refers in particular to balance and steelyard.
sentences.chinese: 本文所述槓桿裝置特指權衡器，包括天平和桿秤。

sentences.english: Steelyard was gradually developed from balance.
sentences.chinese: 桿秤是由天平逐步發展而來的。

definition: lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
disordered and in a mess (idiom); all mixed up and chaotic
the implied message is deep (idiom); having deep implications
Macbeth (name)/Macbeth, 1606 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚
